art_forms.name: Painting
art_forms.description: Painting is the practice of applying paint, pigment, color or other medium to a solid surface. The medium is commonly applied to the base with a brush, but other implements, such as knives, sponges, and airbrushes, can be used.

techniques.name: Oil Painting
techniques.description: A type of slow-drying paint that consists of particles of pigment suspended in a drying oil.
techniques.example: Used by Leonardo da Vinci in Mona Lisa

techniques.name: Watercolor
techniques.description: A painting method in which the paints are made of pigments suspended in a water-based solution.
techniques.example: Popular for landscape paintings and botanical illustrations

techniques.name: Acrylic
techniques.description: Fast-drying paint made of pigment suspended in acrylic polymer emulsion.
techniques.example: Favored by modern artists for its versatility

techniques.name: Fresco
techniques.description: A technique of mural painting executed upon freshly laid lime plaster.

art_forms.name: Sculpture
art_forms.description: Sculpture is the branch of the visual arts that operates in three dimensions. It is one of the plastic arts. Durable sculptural processes originally used carving and modelling, in stone, metal, ceramics, wood and other materials.

techniques.name: Carving
techniques.description: Subtractive process where material is systematically eliminated from the outside in.

techniques.name: Modeling
techniques.description: Additive process where material is built up to create the form.

techniques.name: Casting
techniques.description: Process where liquid material is poured into a mold.
techniques.example: Bronze sculptures like Rodin's The Thinker

techniques.name: Assemblage
techniques.description: Art form where three-dimensional objects are combined to create the artwork.

art_forms.name: Drawing
art_forms.description: Drawing is a form of visual art in which an artist uses instruments to mark paper or other two-dimensional surface. Drawing instruments include graphite pencils, pen and ink, various kinds of paints, inked brushes, colored pencils, crayons, charcoal, chalk, pastels, erasers, markers, styluses, and metals.

techniques.name: Pencil Drawing
techniques.description: Using graphite pencils of various hardnesses to create tonal values.

techniques.name: Charcoal Drawing
techniques.description: Using charcoal sticks to create rich, dark tones and dramatic contrasts.

techniques.name: Ink Drawing
techniques.description: Using various pens and brushes with ink for precise lines and washes.

techniques.name: Pastel Drawing
techniques.description: Using soft pastels for rich color and texture.

art_forms.name: Printmaking
art_forms.description: Printmaking is the process of creating artworks by printing, normally on paper. Printmaking normally covers only the process of creating prints that have an element of originality, rather than just being a photographic reproduction of a painting.

techniques.name: Woodcut
techniques.description: Relief printing technique where the image is carved into wood.

techniques.name: Etching
techniques.description: Intaglio printmaking technique using acid to cut into metal plates.

techniques.name: Lithography
techniques.description: Printing method based on the repulsion of oil and water.
techniques.example: Poster art and fine art prints

techniques.name: Screen Printing
techniques.description: Technique using a mesh screen to transfer ink onto a substrate.

art_forms.name: Digital Art
art_forms.description: Digital art is an artistic work or practice that uses digital technology as part of the creative or presentation process. Since the 1960s, various names have been used to describe the process, including computer art and multimedia art.

techniques.name: Digital Painting
techniques.description: Creating artwork digitally using software that simulates traditional painting.
techniques.example: Concept art for movies and games

techniques.name: 3D Modeling
techniques.description: Creating three-dimensional representations of objects using specialized software.

techniques.name: Photo Manipulation
techniques.description: Altering photographs using digital editing software.

techniques.name: Generative Art
techniques.description: Art created with the use of an autonomous system, often algorithmic.

art_forms.name: Photography
art_forms.description: Photography is the art, application, and practice of creating durable images by recording light or other electromagnetic radiation, either electronically by means of an image sensor, or chemically by means of a light-sensitive material such as photographic film.

techniques.name: Portrait Photography
techniques.description: Capturing the personality and mood of an individual or group.

techniques.name: Landscape Photography
techniques.description: Capturing natural environments and outdoor spaces.
techniques.example: Ansel Adams' black and white landscapes

techniques.name: Street Photography
techniques.description: Capturing everyday life and human condition in public spaces.

techniques.name: Macro Photography
techniques.description: Close-up photography of small subjects at large magnifications.
techniques.example: Detailed shots of insects and flowers
